rows.translation: In the Name of Allah, the All-beneficent, the All-merciful.
Woe to the defrauders, who use short measures,

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ٱكْتَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ
rows.translation: who, when they measure [a commodity bought] from the people, take the full measure,
but diminish when they measure or weigh for them.
rows.transliteration: wa idhā kālūhum aw wazanūhum yukhsirūn

rows.translation: Do they not know that they will be resurrected
on a tremendous day,
a day when mankind will stand before the Lord of all the worlds?

rows.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلْفُجَّارِ لَفِى سِجِّينٍ
rows.translation: Indeed, the record of the vicious is in Sijjeen.
rows.transliteration: kallā inna kitābal fujjāri lafī sijjīn

rows.translation: And what will show you what is Sijjeen?
It is a written record.
Woe to the deniers on that day,
who deny the Day of Retribution;

rows.arabic: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦٓ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
rows.translation: and none denies it except every sinful transgressor.
rows.transliteration: wa mā yukadhhibu bihi illā kullu mu`tadin athīm

rows.arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
rows.translation: When Our signs are recited to him, he says, ‘Myths of the ancients!’

rows.arabic: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ ۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
rows.translation: No, that is not the case! Rather, their hearts have been sullied by what they have been earning.
rows.transliteration: kallā ۖ bal ۜ rāna `alā qulūbihim mā kānū yaksibūn

rows.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُمْ عَن رَّبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّمَحْجُوبُونَ
rows.translation: Indeed, they will be alienated from their Lord on that day.
Afterward they will enter hell,

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
rows.translation: then told, ‘This is what you used to deny!’
rows.transliteration: thumma yuqālu hādhal ladhī kuntum bihi tukadhhibūn

rows.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلْأَبْرَارِ لَفِى عِلِّيِّينَ
rows.translation: Indeed, the record of the pious is in Illeeyun.
And what will show you what is Illeeyun?
It is a written record,
witnessed by those brought near [to Allah].
The pious shall be amid bliss,
observing, [as they recline] on couches.
You will perceive in their faces the freshness of bliss.
They will be served with a sealed pure wine,

rows.arabic: خِتَـٰمُهُۥ مِسْكٌ ۚ وَفِى ذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ ٱلْمُتَنَـٰفِسُونَ
rows.translation: whose seal is musk—for such let the viers vie—
rows.transliteration: khitāmuhu misk ۚ wafī dhālika falyatanāfasil mutanāfisūn

rows.translation: and whose seasoning is from Tasneem,
a spring where those brought near [to Allah] drink.

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا۟ كَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ يَضْحَكُونَ
rows.translation: Indeed the guilty used to laugh at the faithful,
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna ajramū kānū minal ladhīna āmanū yaḍ-ḥakūn

rows.translation: and when they passed them by they would wink at each other,

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُوا۟ فَكِهِينَ
rows.translation: and when they returned to their folks they would return amused,

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَضَآلُّونَ
rows.translation: and when they saw them they would say, ‘Indeed those are the astray!’
rows.transliteration: wa idhā ra-awhum qālū inna hā-ulā-i laḍāllūn

rows.translation: Though they were not sent to watch over them.

rows.arabic: فَٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ
rows.translation: So today the faithful will laugh at the faithless,
rows.transliteration: fal yawmal ladhīna āmanū minal kuffāri yaḍ-ḥakūn

rows.translation: observing from their couches:

rows.arabic: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ ٱلْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْعَلُونَ
rows.translation: Have the faithless been requited for what they used to do?
rows.transliteration: hal thuwwibal kuffāru mā kānū yaf`alūn
